botanical_details.genus: Malus are small to medium-sized deciduous trees with showy flowers in spring and ornamental or edible fruit in autumn; some have good autumn foliage colour

how_to_grow.cultivation: Fairly compact cultivar suitable for all training forms. Keep a clear area around the trunk of at least 60cm radius - apple cultivation. Fruit thinning may be needed. Visit our Grow Your Own guide to apples
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by chip budding or grafting onto a clonal rootstock for fruit. The rootstock used will largely determine the size of the tree
how_to_grow.pruning: Regular pruning required - apple pruning. It is a partial tip bearer
how_to_grow.pests: Aphids, woolly aphid, rosy apple aphid, fruit tree red spider mite, mussel scale, codling moth and caterpillars are the main pests on edible apples
how_to_grow.diseases: Good general resistance to disease in particular to apple scab and powdery mildews. May be affected by apple canker and honey fungus.
